page.title: 01FARLOW & SILVINGTON AREA
page.content:
{FARLOW.}5km (4 miles) North West of Cleobury Mortimer, Shropshire. 2000+ acres. { { SILVINGTON.}A tiny hamlet of only about 50 people with a church, 3 silos, an old monastery (now a farmhouse), & a vicarage.
{BROMDON.}A curious, secluded tiny village, now a caravan holiday park.
This area is predominantly farmland with some common land, all under the slopes of the South Shropshire Clee hills. {The scattered rural communities around {Farlow school lie within a triangle of {main roads linking}Bridgnorth (pop 9000+){14km to N.E. ,}Ludlow (pop 7000+){14km to S.W. &}Bewdley ) (pop 7000+){20km to E.S.E.
